merged_caption: This is a fixed, head-on screen recording of a "Privacy Dashboard" that fills the frame. The camera remains completely static, capturing the dashboard organized into several static panels. Three cards are positioned across the top of the screen: "Your last report" on the top left, "Your subscription" in the top center, and "Tip for you" on the top right. Below these, three numerical counters are located in the center-left, center, and center-right of the frame; the numbers within them rapidly increase. The "TOTAL DATA BROKERS" count rises from 36 to 102, "LISTINGS REVIEWED" from 211 to 593, and "DATA BROKERS WITH YOUR INFO" from 21 to 59. In the lower half of the screen, a bar chart titled "Listings Reviewed" is situated on the bottom left, and a multi-colored donut chart labeled "Your exposed data" is on the bottom right, divided into segments with percentage labels. A cursor enters the frame, moves to the "View Report" button within the top-left card, and clicks it. A vertical navigation menu remains static on the far left throughout the shot. The dashboard features a dark mode theme with white and colored text, and the scene is a screen recording of a software or system interface displaying data visualizations and information.

input_captions.Camera: The camera remains completely static, capturing a screen recording of a privacy dashboard.
input_captions.Subject: A computer screen displays a "Privacy Dashboard" with a dark theme and white and colored text. The dashboard features several data visualization modules. At the top, three cards display information about "Your last report," "Your subscription," and a "Tip for you." Below these, three prominent numerical counters animate, showing figures for "TOTAL DATA BROKERS," "LISTINGS REVIEWED," and "DATA BROKERS WITH YOUR INFO," which increase to 102, 593, and 59, respectively. The lower half of the screen contains a bar chart titled "Listings Reviewed" and a multi-colored donut chart titled "Your exposed data," which is divided into segments with percentage labels.
input_captions.Motion: On a computer screen displaying a privacy dashboard, the numbers in three counters rapidly increase. The "TOTAL DATA BROKERS" count rises from 36 to 102, "LISTINGS REVIEWED" from 211 to 593, and "DATA BROKERS WITH YOUR INFO" from 21 to 59. Simultaneously, a cursor moves to and clicks the "View Report" button.
input_captions.Scene: A screen recording of a software or system interface displays a "Privacy Dashboard" with a dark mode theme. The dashboard is organized into several panels containing data visualizations and information. The top row features cards for "Your last report," "Your subscription," and a "Tip for you." Below, three large numerical displays show metrics for "TOTAL DATA BROKERS," "LISTINGS REVIEWED," and "DATA BROKERS WITH YOUR INFO," with the numbers increasing rapidly. The lower portion of the dashboard includes a bar chart titled "Listings Reviewed" and a multi-colored donut chart labeled "Your exposed data." A cursor moves across the screen and clicks on a "View Report" button. A vertical navigation menu is visible on the left side of the screen.
input_captions.Spatial: This is a fixed, head-on screen recording of a "Privacy Dashboard" that fills the frame. The dashboard is organized into several static panels. Three cards are positioned across the top of the screen: "Your last report" on the top left, "Your subscription" in the top center, and "Tip for you" on the top right. Below these, three numerical counters are located in the center-left, center, and center-right of the frame; the numbers within them rapidly increase. In the lower half of the screen, a bar chart is situated on the bottom left, and a donut chart is on the bottom right. A cursor enters the frame, moves to the "View Report" button within the top-left card, and clicks it. A vertical navigation menu remains static on the far left throughout the shot.

prompt:
Please merge the following five captions into a single, comprehensive caption that describes the video completely without any redundancy.

Caption Types:
1. Subject: Describes the subjects/people in the video
2. Scene: Describes the scene composition and environment
3. Motion: Describes the movement and dynamics of subjects
4. Spatial: Describes the spatial relationships and framing
5. Camera: Describes camera movements and framing choices

Input Captions:
{captions}

Instructions:
1. Use the SPATIAL caption as your BASE structure - it provides the core visual description and framing
2. Merge MOTION and CAMERA captions into the spatial description to create a temporally coherent narrative that describes how things change over time
3. Add information from SUBJECT and SCENE captions ONLY if they contain unique details not already covered in the Spatial caption
4. Eliminate ALL redundant information - if the same detail appears in multiple captions, mention it only ONCE
5. Preserve the EXACT wording from the original captions - do NOT paraphrase
6. When describing temporal changes, integrate motion and camera movements in chronological order to show how the scene evolves
7. CRITICAL: Every unique detail from all five captions must appear in the final merged caption - nothing should be omitted
8. Do NOT add any information not present in the original captions
9. Return only the merged caption without any additional text or formatting

Goal: A single, temporally coherent caption based on the Spatial description, with Motion and Camera information merged chronologically, and Subject/Scene details added only when they provide new information. Keep as many details as possible but limit to at most 320 words.
